title: E.AU.D2 Organisation-wide and cross-organisation logging and monitoring policies to ensure consistency of protocols
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive organization-wide logging through its unified logging framework ensuring consistent protocols across all services. However, monitoring policies are not regularly reviewed for effectiveness despite comprehensive documentation being maintained.

title: E.AU.D3 Employment of real-time monitoring
notes: MOSIP does not implement dedicated real-time security threat detection systems but includes infrastructure monitoring through service mesh and metrics collection. The platform requires external security tooling integration for comprehensive real-time security oversight capabilities.

title: E.AU.D4 The audit trail covers the entire ID lifecycle
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive audit trail capabilities through its audit framework covering identity creation, modification and termination with detailed logging. The platform includes cryptographic utilities for audit log protection though complete implementation depends on proper configuration.

title: E.AU.O1 How often the log is rotated
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive log rotation with configurable criteria including file size limits and time intervals using standardized logging libraries. The audit framework ensures integrity during rotation with support for centralized logging systems and long-term archival.

title: E.AU.O2 How often does the system transfer log-data to a secure log management infrastructure?
notes: MOSIP implements real-time log transfer to centralized logging infrastructure with minimal latency using secure protocols and encryption. The platform includes integrity verification, monitoring dashboards, and delivery success tracking for log transfers.

title: E.AU.O4 Log is transferred and stored in an encrypted format
notes: MOSIP encrypts all log data in transit using industry-standard protocols and supports encrypted storage at rest with strong encryption algorithms. The platform includes comprehensive key management with secure storage and role-based access controls for log data.

title: E.DEC.D1 A  Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) has been developed
notes: MOSIP implements privacy-by-design and security-by-design principles with comprehensive privacy risk assessment capabilities. While no formal GDPR DPIA document exists, the platform provides extensive privacy frameworks and controls that enable organizations to conduct thorough privacy assessments.

title: E.DEC.O1 The system satisfies Article 29 Guidelines and the limitation provided by Article 22 of the GDPR
notes: MOSIP ensures human oversight through manual adjudication components which prevent purely automated decisions in identity verification. The open-source architecture provides transparency and allows individuals to challenge automated decisions through manual review workflows.

title: E.DPP.D1 Creation of a data-scoping document
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive data-scoping documentation including detailed data models, field specifications, and data classification for personal and biometric data. The platform defines clear data flow boundaries between system components with regular documentation updates through version-controlled processes.

title: E.DPP.D2 Description  of Prospective and Data-Structure provenance
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data provenance tracking through its processing pipeline maintaining detailed records of data origin, transformations, and lineage. The platform captures extensive metadata and includes prospective provenance planning capabilities for predicting data transformations.

title: E.DPP.D3 Design of procedures to assess data-quality
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data quality assessment through automated validation engines and quality scoring mechanisms. The platform includes systematic issue tracking with manual adjudication and continuous improvement capabilities for quality metrics monitoring.

title: E.DPP.D4 Provision  for data handling rules
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data handling rules through its privacy and security frameworks covering the entire data lifecycle. The platform provides detailed data classification, role-based access controls, and configurable retention policies with automated enforcement and incident response procedures.

title: E.DPP.O1 Periodic verification that the collected data reside in the declared scope
notes: MOSIP implements periodic verification through its configuration management and compliance frameworks that regularly verify collected data against defined policies. The platform includes automated monitoring capabilities and audit frameworks for detecting scope deviations with systematic remediation processes.

title: E.DPP.O2 For each entity, a single provenance record (or summary) is kept, in a tamper proof way
notes: MOSIP maintains single comprehensive provenance records for each identity with cryptographic integrity protection and digital signatures. The platform provides complete lifecycle tracking with API-based access for audit and compliance verification.

title: E.DPP.O3 Maintenance of Retrospective and Process provenance
notes: MOSIP maintains comprehensive retrospective provenance through its registration processor capturing detailed historical records of all operations and transformations. The platform supports configurable retention policies and provides process provenance information accessible for forensic analysis and troubleshooting.

title: E.DPP.O4 Periodic evaluation of data quality
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data quality evaluation through the registration processor with automated quality assessment and validation rules. The platform evaluates accuracy through biometric validation, completeness through mandatory field checks, and uses automated profiling tools with configurable quality thresholds and systematic correction processes.

title: E.DPP.O5 Deletion routines/procedures are deployed and they are executed correctly
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive deletion procedures through its data management framework with documented policies for secure data disposal and configurable retention periods. The platform ensures secure deletion mechanisms including cryptographic erasure and maintains detailed audit trails for all deletion activities while protecting deleted data confidentiality.

title: E.DPP.O6 Creation, deployment and continuous update of a register with data processing tools
notes: MOSIP maintains comprehensive documentation of all data processing activities through its architecture documentation and module specifications with detailed inventories of processing tools. The platform provides detailed security documentation for all processing components and maintains publicly accessible documentation portals with audit-ready information for compliance verification.

title: E.E.O1 The user can track and monitor legitimate data usage and possible misuses
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive audit capabilities through its audit framework allowing tracking of all data access and authentication events. The open-source architecture ensures transparency and supports identity lifecycle management with consent controls.

title: E.E.O2 The user can track and monitor granted and unallowed accesses
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive access tracking through its audit framework logging all access attempts including authentication events and API calls. The platform supports integration with monitoring and alerting systems while ensuring audit log integrity through cryptographic protection.

title: E.OP.D2 Creation of a data-scoping document
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive data-scoping documentation through its architectural specifications outlining all data types, collection purposes, and processing scope. The platform documents data sensitivity classifications and defines clear system boundaries for handling sensitive information.

title: E.OP.D3 Visibility and justifications for system parameters
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive visibility into system parameters through its configuration management framework and deployment documentation. The platform implements proper configuration management with version control, change tracking, and audit trails for all configuration modifications.

title: P.CDM.D1 Data is adequate and relevant (the purpose and rational are clear)
notes: MOSIP clearly defines data collection purposes through its privacy and data protection framework with comprehensive documentation of data collection rationale and processing purposes. The platform implements data minimization principles ensuring only adequate and relevant data is collected for identity verification.

title: P.CDM.D2 Data is minimised (boundaries are clearly stated)
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data minimization through well-defined data collection boundaries, data classification schemes, and technical controls that limit collection to essential demographic and biometric data required for identity verification purposes.

title: P.CDM.O1 Pseudo-anonymisation of personal data
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive pseudo-anonymisation through cryptographic techniques, advanced privacy controls, and monitoring capabilities that protect personal data while maintaining utility for legitimate identity verification purposes.

title: P.CDM.O2 Deployment of recommendation algorithms
notes: MOSIP uses standard cryptographic algorithms like AES, RSA, and SHA through its cryptographic services framework. The platform follows an open-source approach with well-documented algorithms and supports HSM integration for enhanced security.

title: P.CDM.O4 Timely validation of the provenance of critical and system control data
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive validation through its audit framework, monitoring tools, and integrity controls that enable timely verification of critical data sources and system controls for cybersecurity incident detection and response.

title: P.IDA.D1 Provision for removing duplicate and false ID records / attributes
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive duplicate detection through advanced deduplication algorithms, biometric matching, data validation frameworks, manual adjudication systems, and detailed audit trails for maintaining data quality and accuracy.

title: P.IDA.D2 Provision for ID revocation
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive identity revocation through ID lifecycle management, systematic revocation procedures, detailed audit trails, integrated IAM capabilities, and complete access removal mechanisms for effective identity management.

title: P.IDA.D3 Provision for updating and re-proofing identity attributes that change over time
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive update mechanisms through ID lifecycle management, systematic re-proofing processes, data validation frameworks, multiple authentication methods, and detailed audit trails for maintaining accurate identity information over time.

title: P.IDA.D4 Provision for detecting insufficient distribution of revocation lists to distributed services
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive revocation list distribution through certificate management frameworks, systematic monitoring capabilities, automated update mechanisms, validation processes, and detailed audit trails for secure certificate management across distributed services.

title: P.IDA.D5 Controlled and consistent ID attribute data ingest processes defined
notes: MOSIP implements controlled data ingestion through well-defined workflows, comprehensive validation procedures, standardized collection methods, detailed monitoring capabilities, and data integrity mechanisms for consistent identity attribute processing.

title: P.IDA.O1 Ratio of valid data to erroneous data in the database
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data validation, systematic monitoring, automated error handling, audit capabilities, and continuous improvement mechanisms to maintain high ratios of valid to erroneous data in the database.

title: P.IDA.O2 Attribute-based encryption applied
notes: MOSIP implements attribute-based access control and encryption through comprehensive security frameworks, cryptographic protection, multiple encryption schemes, audit capabilities, and secure key management for fine-grained identity data protection.

title: P.IDA.O3 Privileged Identity Management (PIM) services deployed
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive Privileged Identity Management with role-based access control, session management, monitoring capabilities, detailed audit trails, and secure lifecycle management for all privileged identities and administrative accounts.

title: P.IDA.O4 Inter-directory provisioning
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive inter-directory provisioning with user data synchronization, standardized protocols (LDAP, SCIM, SAML), data consistency validation, monitoring capabilities, and secure authentication for cross-system operations.

title: P.IDA.O5 All data mapped to corresponding metadata
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data-to-metadata mapping for all identity attributes with systematic metadata management, metadata-driven validation, audit traceability, and standardized metadata frameworks for interoperability and governance.

title: P.IDA.O6 Conformance with GDPR
notes: MOSIP implements privacy-by-design principles and provides core privacy protection capabilities including consent mechanisms, data minimization, and audit trails. However, comprehensive GDPR compliance requires full implementation of individual data rights (particularly data portability) and formal compliance processes that may need additional development.

title: P.LAR.D1 Established protocols for data archiving
notes: MOSIP implements basic data lifecycle management with retention policies and secure deletion capabilities. However, formal digital archiving standards like OAIS and ISO 16363 require specific implementation and certification processes not explicitly provided by MOSIP core platform.

title: P.LAR.D2 Provision for compliance with data retention directive(s)
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data retention through lifecycle management, secure storage mechanisms, automated deletion capabilities, audit trails, and governance frameworks for compliance with data retention directives.

title: P.LAR.O1 User retention rate
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive user analytics through observability frameworks, systematic monitoring capabilities, user experience optimization, privacy-compliant tracking mechanisms, and audit capabilities for measuring user retention and engagement.

title: P.LAR.O2 User churn rate
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive churn analysis through analytics frameworks, systematic monitoring capabilities, behavior analysis for churn prevention, privacy-compliant tracking, and detailed reporting for user retention optimization.

title: P.LAR.O4 Repeat user rate
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive repeat user tracking through analytics frameworks, systematic monitoring capabilities, retention optimization based on insights, privacy-compliant tracking mechanisms, and audit capabilities for user loyalty measurement.

title: P.LAR.O5 User participation rate
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive user participation tracking through analytics frameworks, systematic monitoring capabilities, engagement optimization, privacy-compliant interaction tracking, and audit capabilities for user involvement measurement.

title: P.LAR.O7 Compliance with European Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive data protection mechanisms, explicit consent management, individual rights support, robust security measures, and compliance monitoring for adherence to European Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC requirements.

title: P.PIA.D1 Provision for a DPIA policy and review processes
notes: While MOSIP includes privacy-by-design principles and risk assessment capabilities, it does not provide formal GDPR-compliant DPIA policies or systematic processes. Organizations using MOSIP must develop their own DPIA frameworks.

title: P.PIA.D4 Privacy risk register present
notes: MOSIP includes privacy-by-design principles, security framework, and risk management capabilities. However, it does not provide a formal GDPR-compliant privacy risk register as a systematic tool. Risk assessment is embedded in the security framework but not formalized as a dedicated privacy risk register with regular review processes.

title: P.PIA.D5 Applicability of the guidance document
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive documentation including implementation guides and security guidelines. However, it does not have formal systematic processes for determining guidance document applicability or regulatory context mapping. The documentation is primarily technical implementation guidance rather than regulatory compliance guidance.

title: P.PIA.D6 Commencement of PIA at the design stage
notes: MOSIP implements privacy-by-design principles and privacy risk considerations throughout its development lifecycle. However, it does not provide formal PIA processes or systematic documentation for design-stage privacy impact assessments. Privacy considerations are embedded in the architecture but not formalized as distinct PIA processes.

title: P.PIA.O2 Privacy risk register periodically updated
notes: MOSIP has monitoring capabilities, audit trails, and risk assessment frameworks embedded in its security architecture. However, it does not maintain a formal privacy risk register that requires periodic updates. Privacy risk management is integrated into the overall security framework rather than maintained as a separate systematic register.

title: P.PIA.O3 Evidence of progress in the implementation / deployment of privacy controls
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive audit capabilities, documentation tracking, and privacy control implementation evidence through its security and governance frameworks. However, it does not provide dedicated privacy training programs or awareness initiatives as part of the platform. Such training would need to be implemented by deploying organizations.

title: P.PIA.O4 Track progress when reducing privacy risks with flexible in-depth reporting
notes: MOSIP has monitoring capabilities and audit frameworks that can provide technical operational reports. However, it does not have dedicated privacy risk reporting mechanisms or stakeholder-specific privacy dashboards. The platform provides infrastructure that could support such reporting but doesn't include built-in privacy risk tracking reports.

title: P.PIA.O5 Privacy risk mitigation accountability established
notes: MOSIP provides role-based access control and audit capabilities that support accountability structures. However, it does not establish formal privacy risk mitigation accountability frameworks, data protection officer roles, or training programs. These organizational responsibilities would need to be implemented by deploying organizations based on their regulatory requirements.

title: P.PIA.O6 Use of an automation engine to kick off additional assessments when triggered
notes: MOSIP has monitoring capabilities and audit trails that could support automation, and its cloud-native architecture provides scalability. However, it does not include automated privacy assessment engines or trigger-based privacy evaluations. Such capabilities would require custom development on top of the MOSIP platform.

title: P.PRMP.D2 Register of intended processing activities
notes: MOSIP documents its data processing activities, data types, and purposes within its architecture and data management frameworks. However, it does not maintain a formal GDPR-compliant register of processing activities as a systematic tool. Organizations deploying MOSIP would need to create and maintain such a register based on MOSIP's capabilities.

title: P.PRMP.D3 Provision for technical & operational privacy controls
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive technical privacy controls including multi-factor authentication, biometric access controls, role-based permissions, advanced encryption, cryptographic protection, data minimization practices, monitoring capabilities, and systematic privacy control frameworks.

title: P.PRMP.D4 Privacy risk evaluation criteria established
notes: MOSIP provides strong technical privacy risk controls and security frameworks but lacks formal privacy risk evaluation criteria as a systematic methodology. Technical safeguards and risk-appropriate controls are implemented through the security framework, but systematic privacy-specific evaluation criteria are not formally defined.

title: P.PRMP.D5 Privacy risk Impact criteria established
notes: MOSIP provides strong data classification capabilities, risk assessment frameworks, and technical privacy controls that support impact evaluation. However, formal privacy impact criteria as systematic methodologies for breach severity evaluation are not comprehensively documented as standalone procedures.

title: P.PRMP.D6 Privacy Risk acceptance criteria established
notes: MOSIP provides risk management frameworks, security standards integration, and governance structures that support privacy risk management. However, formal privacy risk acceptance criteria as systematic organizational baseline methodologies are not explicitly defined as standalone procedures.

title: P.PRMP.O1 Privacy risk mitigation accountability established
notes: MOSIP provides basic governance structures and role-based access control. However, specific data protection officer roles and comprehensive privacy training programs are not explicitly documented and would require implementation by deploying organizations.

title: P.PRMP.O5 Vendor 3rd party privacy risk assessment conducted
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive third-party vendor privacy risk assessment with systematic PIAs, standardized evaluation frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST), audit and compliance verification, and continuous monitoring for all vendor relationships.

title: P.PS.D1 Provision for a PIM  as part of the DID System
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive Privacy Information Management through privacy frameworks, resident services for individual control, secure authentication mechanisms, integrated privacy risk management, and detailed audit capabilities within the decentralized identity system.

title: P.PS.O1 Conformance with ISO 27701
notes: MOSIP provides strong technical privacy capabilities and security controls that align with ISO 27701 requirements, but lacks formal PIMS establishment, systematic privacy management processes, and continuous improvement frameworks as required by the standard.

title: P.PS.O2 Conformance with ISO GDPR
notes: MOSIP implements strong technical GDPR compliance including privacy-by-design, consent mechanisms, individual data rights support, and comprehensive audit capabilities. Lacks formal privacy impact assessment processes and comprehensive compliance documentation frameworks required by GDPR organizational requirements.

title: P.PS.O4 Conformance with ISO 27550
notes: MOSIP provides strong technical privacy risk assessment capabilities and comprehensive audit trails. However, lacks formal systematic data protection impact assessment processes and ISO 27550-compliant DPIA frameworks as required by the standard. Technical privacy controls are robust but organizational DPIA processes are not formalized.

title: P.PS.O5 Conformance with ISO 29101
notes: MOSIP demonstrates excellent ISO 29101 compliance with comprehensive privacy-enhancing technologies including cryptographic protection, secure authentication, privacy-preserving architecture, and detailed audit capabilities that effectively balance privacy protection with system functionality.

title: P.RIP.D1 Provision for Combined Remote identity proofing methods
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive combined remote identity proofing with multi-factor authentication, advanced biometric verification, knowledge-based authentication, and NIST SP 800-63-3 compliance for secure remote identity verification.

title: P.RIP.D2 Provision for non-predictable registration officers' pool
notes: MOSIP provides strong security, audit capabilities, and standards compliance for registration processes. However, lacks formal non-predictable registration officer pool mechanisms with random selection algorithms. Strong technical controls for information security and officer activity monitoring.

title: P.RIP.D3 Confirmation that the presented identity information is valid
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive identity information validation with knowledge-based authentication, biometric verification, document authenticity checking, digital verification capabilities, and detailed audit trails for all validation processes.

title: P.RIP.D4 Confirmation that a valid identity is associated with the correct individual
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive identity-to-individual association verification with multi-factor authentication, biometric matching, document verification, cross-reference validation, and detailed audit capabilities to prevent identity fraud and ensure accurate identity ownership confirmation.

title: P.RIP.D5 provision for baseline attributes required to obtain the highest possible percentage of coverage
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive baseline attribute collection with biometric services, privacy-compliant data collection, multi-channel verification capabilities, and detailed audit trails to maximize identity verification coverage while protecting privacy.

title: P.RIP.D6 Obligations and rights of participants documented
notes: MOSIP provides strong individual data protection rights documentation and informed consent processes. However, lacks comprehensive formal documentation of participant obligations, organizational compliance requirements, and systematic participant communication frameworks for rights and obligations.

title: P.RIP.O3 Evidence of periodic vetting of operators
notes: MOSIP provides strong security policies and standards compliance but lacks formal systematic periodic operator vetting processes, background verification procedures, and regular assessment schedules as required for comprehensive operator vetting programs.

title: P.RIP.O4 Baseline assessment for the validity of identity proofs
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive baseline assessment capabilities with document verification, authenticity checking, cross-reference validation, biometric verification, and detailed audit trails for all identity proof validation activities.

title: P.RIP.O5 Validation of the existence of claimed identity overall period of time
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive identity existence validation with third-party verification, public record checking, background verification, biometric validation, temporal consistency checking, and detailed audit capabilities throughout the verification period.

title: P.SU.D1 Provision for secondary use service (SUS)
notes: MOSIP is primarily a digital identity platform focused on ID lifecycle management. While it has consent management, audit trails, and data protection measures, it does not provide dedicated secondary use services for repurposing personal data as described. Secondary data usage would require additional implementation on top of MOSIP's base platform.

title: P.SU.D3 Agreement(s) on how cross-organisation information flow is enforced
notes: MOSIP provides partner management capabilities and APIs for integration with external organizations but is primarily designed as a national identity platform rather than a cross-organizational data sharing system. While it includes security controls and audit capabilities, comprehensive cross-organizational consent management requires additional implementation.

title: P.SU.D4 Provision for a record management system
notes: MOSIP has identity data repository, audit logging, and lifecycle management capabilities that support record management functions for identity data. However, it is not a general-purpose enterprise record management system. Its record capabilities are focused on identity credentials and related audit data rather than comprehensive organizational records.

title: P.SU.O2 Flow control restrictions for internal and external traffic to the The Distributed Incident Management System (DIMS)
notes: MOSIP is a digital identity platform, not a distributed incident management system. While MOSIP has network security controls, encryption, and audit capabilities, it does not implement a DIMS system as described.

title: P.SU.O3 Designated policy enforcement Point(s)
notes: MOSIP has API Gateway and Keycloak-based access controls that perform policy enforcement functions, but it does not implement dedicated XACML-style PEP architecture. The system uses service-level controls and JWT token validation rather than formal PEP components.

title: P.SU.O4 Automatic verification of write permissions for information between different domains
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive access controls, authentication, and encryption capabilities. However, as a unified identity platform, it does not specifically operate in a multi-domain architecture requiring cross-domain write permission verification. The platform provides API-level access controls and audit logging for data operations.

title: P.TIP.D3 Provision for referential identity graphs
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive referential identity graphs with unique identifier management, automated data linking, standardized protocols, and identity data mapping across multiple systems using UIN, VID, and integration frameworks.

title: P.TIP.D4 Provision for an in-build record management system
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive integrated record management with centralized storage, automated workflows, compliance features for secure data handling, and integration capabilities for identity-related records and documents.

title: P.TIP.O2 Log data correlation
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive log data correlation with multi-source log aggregation, pattern identification, security threat detection, automated analysis, and integrated logging capabilities across all systems.

title: P.UC.D1 User consent has been obtained
notes: MOSIP implements consent mechanisms through its registration process ensuring explicit user consent is obtained before collecting personal or biometric data during enrollment. However, comprehensive consent withdrawal and modification capabilities through resident services may require additional implementation depending on deployment.

title: P.UC.D2 Data processing has been declared
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive data processing declarations with clear purposes, legal basis, accessibility, and systematic updates ensuring transparent declaration of all processing activities.

title: P.UC.D3 Provision for the types of processing that require a DPIA
notes: MOSIP provides strong technical privacy capabilities for biometric processing, new technologies, and automated decision-making. However, lacks formal systematic DPIA processes for identifying and assessing processing activities that require privacy impact assessments as specified by GDPR.

title: P.UC.D4 Provision for Dispute resolution
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive dispute resolution with grievance management, clear procedures, fair processes, documentation tracking, and timely communication through resident services and case management capabilities.

title: P.UC.D5 Training provision for manual verification
notes: MOSIP provides strong standardized procedures, quality assurance measures, and comprehensive documentation for manual verification activities. However, lacks formal systematic training programs and competency assessments for verification personnel as described in the metric.

title: P.UC.D6 Criteria for issuing data retention notice
notes: MOSIP establishes comprehensive criteria for data retention notices with legal requirements integration, law enforcement support, business needs consideration, and systematic review processes through its data lifecycle management framework.

title: P.UC.D7 Requirements for secure data disposal
notes: MOSIP implements secure data disposal through its data lifecycle management with automated deletion, retention policies, and audit trails. The platform provides software-based secure deletion mechanisms but does not directly handle physical hardware destruction, which requires separate infrastructure-level procedures.

title: P.UC.D8 Provision for DRR procedures
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive disaster recovery and resilience procedures with automated backup systems, high availability architecture, redundancy, failover capabilities, regular testing, and systematic disaster response protocols.

title: P.UC.O1 Periodic assessment for regulatory conformance of consent policies
notes: MOSIP provides strong regulatory review, gap analysis, remediation capabilities, and ongoing monitoring. However, lacks formal systematic periodic assessment processes for consent policy regulatory conformance as described in the organizational metric.

title: P.UC.O2 Consent as a precondition of a service
notes: MOSIP implements appropriate consent mechanisms with voluntary practices, essential service access without unnecessary consent requirements, clear consent categorization, meaningful user choice, and ethical consent validity verification.

title: P.UC.O3 Compliance with the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000 (RIPA)
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive compliance mechanisms with legal frameworks, oversight systems, lawful interception capabilities, privacy safeguards, and detailed audit trails ensuring RIPA compliance while maintaining civil liberties protections.

title: P.UC.O4 Dispute management system deployed & operationalised
notes: MOSIP provides basic complaint management capabilities through its Resident Services module with case tracking and status updates. The platform includes audit capabilities for tracking complaint resolution but lacks comprehensive dispute management features like formal mediation processes or structured dispute resolution frameworks.

title: P.UC.O5 Automated validation and verification of documentation
notes: MOSIP implements automated validation and verification through its Registration Processor with comprehensive document processing, data extraction, validation rules, and system integration capabilities. The platform provides digital signature verification and supports integration with external business systems for consistent data management.

title: P.UC.O7 Right to be informed has been enforced
notes: MOSIP enforces the right to be informed with comprehensive privacy framework, clear information provision, transparent communication, updated policies, and accessible mechanisms for individuals to understand data processing activities.

title: P.UL.D1 DUL statements per consent group defined
notes: MOSIP provides strong privacy framework and consent management capabilities with accessible documentation. However, lacks formal systematic Data Use Limitation (DUL) statement definitions for specific consent groups as described in the metric. The platform focuses more on overall privacy controls than granular consent group-specific limitations.

title: P.UL.D2 Purpose(s) for processing defined in privacy information
notes: MOSIP clearly defines processing purposes with legitimate legal basis, transparent communication, data minimization principles, and comprehensive compliance accountability for all identity processing activities.

title: P.UL.O1 User data collection procedure compliant with documentation obligations to specify EIDMS's purpose(s)
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive user data collection procedures with documentation compliance, clear EIDMS purpose specification, consent management, data minimization principles, and data lifecycle management in accordance with GDPR and regulatory requirements.

title: P.UL.O2 Monitoring of changes in data collection purpose(s)
notes: MOSIP provides strong audit capabilities, compliance checking, transparency, and user control mechanisms. However, lacks formal systematic monitoring of data collection purpose changes and automated purpose change detection as described in the metric.

title: P.UL.O4 Consent for new purpose has been obtained
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive consent management with systematic collection, transparent communication, documentation, opt-in mechanisms, consent withdrawal capabilities, and data minimization principles for new processing purposes.

title: P.WDPP.D1 Provision for a Privacy Risk Management Framework (PRF)
notes: MOSIP provides strong technical privacy risk assessment, mitigation measures, continuous monitoring, and compliance capabilities. However, lacks formal systematic Privacy Risk Management Framework (PRF) as an organizational structure with comprehensive training and communication programs.

title: P.WDPP.D2 Privacy vision and mission statement
notes: MOSIP establishes comprehensive privacy vision and mission with clear privacy commitment, long-term goals, core privacy values, defined objectives, and alignment with legal requirements and industry best practices.

title: P.WDPP.D3 Alignment of the PRF with ISO27001
notes: MOSIP aligns Privacy Risk Management Framework with ISO 27001 standards through comprehensive risk assessments, appropriate security controls, aligned policies and procedures, and continuous monitoring for both privacy and security measures.

title: P.WDPP.O1 Legitimate interest assessment
notes: MOSIP provides privacy framework documentation and audit capabilities but does not specifically implement formal Legitimate Interest Assessment (LIA) processes as required by GDPR Article 6(1)(f). Deployment organizations would need to implement LIA procedures for legitimate interest processing.

title: P.WDPP.O2 Data breach readiness assessment
notes: MOSIP provides strong incident response plans, data identification, and testing capabilities. However, lacks formal systematic data breach readiness assessment processes and comprehensive staff training programs as organizational requirements.

title: P.WDPP.O3 International data transfer assessment
notes: MOSIP provides strong data identification, security safeguards, risk documentation, and compliance monitoring capabilities. However, lacks formal systematic international data transfer assessment processes as an organizational requirement for cross-border data protection evaluation.

title: REL.AL.D1 Identification of CDD measures using risk-based approach(es)
notes: MOSIP implements technical risk-based authentication and identity verification with systematic risk assessment and appropriate CDD measures. However, lacks formal AML compliance documentation and regulatory frameworks required for financial CDD requirements. Provides comprehensive audit trails for identity verification activities.

title: REL.AL.D10 Assurance levels for identity proofing
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive tiered assurance levels with NIST alignment, integrated biometric and multi-factor authentication, risk-based assurance selection, documented decision trails, and flexible assurance management. Excellent technical implementation of identity proofing assurance frameworks.

title: REL.AL.D3 Provision for standardised ID proofing requirements
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive standardized identity proofing with international standards compliance (ISO 29115, NIST SP 800-63), multi-factor authentication, risk-based verification, documented procedures, and electronic identification support. Strong technical framework with well-defined verification standards.

title: REL.AL.D4 Establish evidence collection requirements
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive evidence collection through audit logging, forensic compliance (ISO 27037), chain of custody protocols, and automated evidence preservation. However, lacks formal legal testing procedures for evidence admissibility verification.

title: REL.AL.D5 Provision for compliance with FATF49 policies and guidelines
notes: MOSIP provides identity verification capabilities suitable for customer due diligence, comprehensive record keeping through audit systems, and interoperability frameworks. However, lacks specific FATF49 compliance implementation, automated suspicious activity reporting, and formal AML/CTF risk-based approaches as MOSIP is primarily a digital identity platform rather than a financial services system.

title: REL.AL.D6 Identification of CDD measures using risk-based approach(es)
notes: MOSIP implements risk-based identity verification with automated risk assessment, tiered verification procedures, documented processes, and comprehensive audit trails. However, designed primarily for digital identity rather than financial CDD compliance requirements.

title: REL.AL.D7 Provision for managing liability and legal issues
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive legal compliance frameworks, data breach response procedures, legal inquiry processing, and compliance audit trails. However, lacks integrated liability insurance and indemnification measures as these are typically organizational rather than technical implementations.

title: REL.AL.D8 Legal structure in place for roles, rights and responsibilities
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive legal structures with defined roles, documented data protection policies, role-based access controls, data subject rights procedures, and compliance monitoring. Strong technical framework with well-defined governance structures.

title: REL.AL.D9 Provision for self-assessment
notes: MOSIP provides comprehensive self-assessment through compliance frameworks, automated monitoring tools, continuous compliance tracking, and documented assessment results. However, lacks formal benchmarking capabilities against industry standards - relies on implementation-specific configurations rather than built-in benchmarking tools.

title: REL.AL.O1 Evidence of assessing ID proofing at different IAL
notes: MOSIP maintains comprehensive evidence of IAL assessments with detailed audit logs, testing capabilities, compliance reporting, and continuous monitoring. Strong technical framework for identity proofing evidence management across different assurance levels.

title: REL.AL.O10 Conformance with eIDAS
notes: MOSIP provides strong eIDAS conformance capabilities with technical security measures, assessment procedures, authentication compliance, and documentation. However, full eIDAS conformance requires formal EU accreditation processes that depend on implementation and jurisdictional context.

title: REL.AL.O11 Conformance with ISO 29115
notes: MOSIP demonstrates comprehensive ISO 29115 conformance with systematic assurance level assessment, multi-entity authentication, risk assessment methodology, and compliance documentation. Excellent implementation of entity authentication assurance framework standards.

title: REL.AL.O2 Auditing of resolution-validation-verification processes in ID proofing
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive auditing of resolution-validation-verification processes with detailed audit trails, accuracy verification, trusted source validation, biometric authenticity auditing, and real-time monitoring. Excellent technical implementation of identity proofing process auditing.

title: S.AAA.D2 Provision for policy enforcement using standard protocols
notes: MOSIP enforces security policies via standard protocols including OAuth 2.0 tokens but does not use a dedicated XACML-based policy framework. MOSIP does not deploy standalone Policy Decision Point or Policy Information Point components, however, it uses Keycloak module that validates all communication among microservices.

title: S.AAA.D3 System capable of combining policy rules of different policies
notes: MOSIP allows importing per-partner policies in the Policy Management Service. However, MOSIP does not offer any built-in conflict-detection or resolution mechanism for policies. Each microservice simply enforces the policy it has been given, with no global conflict-resolution logic. MOSIP's Policy Management Service does not include any facility to assign numeric priorities or precedence among distinct policy bundles for automatic conflict reconciliation.

title: S.AAA.D4 AC system capable of combining different policy models
notes: MOSIP supports multiple access control models including Role-based access control, Group-based access control, Attribute-based access control, Time-based access control, and JavaScript-based custom logic. MOSIP Keycloak issues a JWT at login combining the results of whatever policies are defined at that moment, and each MOSIP service validates that token. Keycloak validates all communication among microservices. MOSIP Keycloak allows the creation of custom policies and providers via its Service-Provider Interface, including custom Policy Information Points for attribute lookup or entirely new policy evaluators.

title: S.AAA.D5 AC functions to convert, import, or export external AC policies
notes: MOSIP supports custom JSON documents for policy management. However, MOSIP does not provide automatic conversion between different access control models. The system does not maintain version history or allow rollback to prior imports, nor does it store information about the origin of policies.

title: S.AAA.D6 Provision to enforce the least privilege principle (PoLP)
notes: MOSIP Keycloak uses tokens which seem to only contain roles and not attributes, hence permissions appear to be only available at the resource and scope level. MOSIP does not offer built-in segregation of duties enforcement. MOSIP services trust only JWT claims issued at login with no runtime attribute lookup, so MOSIP cannot dynamically scope data queries by attributes at the policy layer. MOSIP does not include an integrated privilege-request and approval workflow.

title: S.AAA.D7 System capable of specifying Static SoD rules
notes: MOSIP and its Keycloak integration do not support declarative static segregation of duties rules at any granularity including global, per-application, or per-data domain levels. MOSIP cannot grant scoped exceptions that automatically expire; any such override would require a custom Keycloak Service Provider Interface extension or external process.

title: S.AAA.D8 Dynamic SoD rules
notes: MOSIP does not include a dynamic segregation of duties engine. The system cannot write dynamic rules that combine attributes, actions, and context for real-time conflict detection. MOSIP has no built-in mechanism to quarantine changes or gate them behind secondary approval when segregation of duties conflicts occur.

title: S.AC.D1 Provision for Deterrent Controls

The system provides logging capabilities through its audit framework and basic health monitoring. title: S.AC.D10 Provision for session termination
notes: MOSIP provides session termination capabilities through its authentication services and Keycloak integration allowing users to log out. title: S.AC.D2 Provision for Preventative Controls
notes: MOSIP implements comprehensive access controls through Keycloak integration with role-based and attribute-based access control mechanisms. The deployment architecture includes network security controls and segmentation.

title: S.AC.D3 Provision for Detective Controls

notes: MOSIP uses standard protocols including OAuth 2.0 and JWT for access control communication between components.
